title: Grand Riemann hypothesis
summary: In mathematics, the grand Riemann hypothesis is a generalisation of the Riemann hypothesis and generalized Riemann hypothesis. It states that the nontrivial zeros of all automorphic L-functions lie on the critical line 1 2 + i t {\displaystyle {\frac {1}{2}}+it} with t {\displaystyle t} a real number variable and i {\displaystyle i} the imaginary unit.
